website_summaries.verdict: The Sony Cyber-shot RX100 III is an overall great camera that delivers significant improvements over the RX100 II, but not everyone will think it's worth the extra cost.
pros: A great electronic viewfinder that doesn't increase the size of the svelte Sony Cyber-shot RX100 III is one of the camera's highlights
Plus it offers excellent performance, photo and video quality
cons: The camera shuts down when you retract the viewfinder, the autofocus system could be more consistent, and it has poor battery life

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this camera
customer_reviews.text: The camera repeatedly shows up in the top 10 list of everyone that reviews point and shoots. It does everything the reviews say. But, the flash will burn out. I bought my first one and it lasted about a year, right past the warrenty and the flash burned out. I tried several shops to get it repaired and it cannot be repaired. I liked the camera so much, I assumed I had a lemon and bought a second one. The second one lasted about a year and it burned out. ugh. I am switching to Canon.
customer_reviews.author: rw

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful camera with a fatal flaw
customer_reviews.text: By now, you know all the reasons why this is a fabulous camera. But it has a design defect. On some models (one I purchased and two I subsequently heard about), the lens cover sometimes does not fully retract when the camera powers up. You don't know this happened unless you look very closely at the image on the screen. This ruined several of my recent vacation photos. I'm returning the camera I bought for a replacement in hopes of getting one without the defect.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Klossner

customer_reviews.title: Best non-DSLR camera I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for about 3 years now and love it. No problems. Amazing picture quality. I was sick of lugging around my Canon 5DmkIII on trips, etc (for pleasure, not work) and didn't want to carry so much stuff and weight and be a target. This is small but powerful and a good replacement with manual controls, RAW, etc. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: slightly sharper images (DR and ISO are pretty much the same)
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to replace my RX100 mark 1. My RX100 is still working perfectly. I just needed a wider angle of view, which the 3 provides, and I also appreciate the other big step ups with the 3: slightly sharper images (DR and ISO are pretty much the same), tilty LCD, selfie LCD, pop-up viewfinder while keeping the flash, fn menu that matches my Sony a7 and a6000 (I've made the settings the same across all 3 cameras). A great, great camera and in my opinion, there isn't one better that fits in your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: WK

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: The camera itself is solid. something very important to know about the camera is to have your screen out when you flip out the screen. If you just flip it then you're going to scratch your screen. I don't much like the fact that the screen can't be inside out because this is a phone i'd love to have in my pocket.....with my keys. The video quality is amazing, and the photos compete with DSLRs, the audio quality is ok, but much better than most other point and shoots. Considering you're probably here for video. Here's a vlog on youtube at 1080p 60fps 50mps: [...]
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: I love my camera and would recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.text: I love my camera and would recommend this to anyone. I bought this after researching online for a good camera to take on a long hiking trip and this was one that came highly recommended. I have taken this camera on a trip to Florida and on many hiking trips to our local state parks. I find the pictures are nice, the camera is small and fits in the pocket of my hiking pants and in the pocket of my athletic pants. I am pretty sure I still need to learn some things about the camera, but it's an ongoing process for me.
customer_reviews.author: SHERRY M DAUGHERTY

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect Travel Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is one of the most highly rated for travel, point-and-shoot, and I see why. It is ALMOST perfect. Takes great pictures and has any feature you could ask for. Rugged and 'reasonably' easy to learn to operate. Popular so there is even a Facebook group for owners to trade tips and examples of photo techniques. Glad I bought it - but SONY, please consider making the next model have a longer zoom lens. The only thing I love about my (still) backup Panasonic Lumix ZS60 (Costco) is the amazingly long lens. Add this, Sony, and you have five stars.
customer_reviews.author: M. Guerin

customer_reviews.title: best pocket camera ever
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing camera. i read lots of reviews before buying and am thrilled with it. the photos are fabulous (especially when using the electronic view finder) and the videos are clear and bright. i took it backpacking in the Rockies and loved every shot and video i took. I use it mainly it C or auto mode but for more experienced photographers it has all of the bells and whistles of a DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: john judson

customer_reviews.title: Great camera overall
customer_reviews.text: Great compact camera to take around everyday on your person and shoot professional photos, I had the RX 100ii for years and it was mistakenly damaged so I got the one to replace it, the big difference the RX 100 ii have a hot shoe RX 100 iii don’t carry one. The RX 100 ii is the only one that have the hot shoe which makes it unique, but overall the RX 100 series are all great compact cameras can’t lose with any version.
customer_reviews.author: courtney

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Still and Video Camera for an Amateur
customer_reviews.text: This camera lives up to the hype. Takes great photos with very little effort while still having the options and controls for more skilled photographers to take even better photos. It makes an excellent, portable 1080p video camera as well. Its optical image stablization and high bitrate creates truly jawdropping video even in the hands of a total amateur. My only complaints with this camera is that it sometimes has issue finding focus and, so far, it tends to drop the ball when trying to capture moving targets (the result is usually a blur). However I'm fairly its my own inexperience at work there, given that I've only used the camera presets so far.
customer_reviews.author: King of Heroes

customer_reviews.title: Does its #1 job - great sharp photos - very well
customer_reviews.text: Does its #1 job - great sharp photos - very well. 1 star knocked off as its UI is not as friendly as, say Panasonics. But at the end of the day you want the best possible photo, and this Sony does a fantastic job at that. For a compact bag I use, the RX100III fits snugly into it.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Perks

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal camera!
customer_reviews.text: This camera has everything I've ever wanted in a compact. Legitimate viewfinder, full manual controls, fast lens, fast frame rate (10fps+!) and it's very small and light weight. It's the camera I've been waiting for since digital cameras came out. (no joke - there isn't another digital camera on the market that comes even CLOSE to offering what the RX100 III does.) It has officially replaced my Canon 5d3 setup for travel. Excellent as an underwater camera as well (with use of Nauticam underwater housing, of course).
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great quality pictures in such a small package.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is fantastic. I bought this to mainly do videos and the quality is so nice. Especially in such a compact form. It's so easy to carry around and easy to operate. The picture quality is fantastic, too. In low light it really shines. Can't really ask for much more in such a small compact camera. Definitely worth it if you are looking for something compact and easy to whip out when you need it. It takes great quality pictures.
customer_reviews.author: mchendesign

customer_reviews.title: Nice lil all rounder...
customer_reviews.text: Replaces my RX 100 II.. gave it as a gift to a friend and got me the III :) nice way to hoodwink my wife into thinkin i needed it :) It is a good replacement for the mkII. I havent used the pop up viewfinder as much as i thought i would... but it is a nice addition. The lens is marginally better but the screen does make takin selfies with family easy... quiet easy actually. I do love wide angle photography so i do appreciate the 24mm wide end.. and the built in ND filter. Lovely camera... All in all it was worth the upgrade for me (although to clarify i did buy it used, like the MkII)
customer_reviews.author: Pary

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent camera, by far the best point and shoot I've ever used. Photo quality is very good and the video is absolutely beautiful. The burst function is pretty quick and low light performance is better than expected. I am a little disappointed that there is no shotshoe or aux audio input, but I'll find ways around that. Things to consider before buying: no hotshoe or aux input if you want to shoot the highest quality video you will need a very fast SDXC card and they come in at a minimum 64gb capacity
customer_reviews.author: PeteTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera!! I'm glad I bought this over Canon G7X. Great pictures, even newbies can easily take great picture. Unless you're looking for 4K video (I already have GoPro for that), you wouldn't need to buy the DSC-RX 100M IV. Save yourself a couple hundred dollars.
customer_reviews.author: S.K.

customer_reviews.title: It's something about the Sony chip that produces my favorite looking pictures
customer_reviews.text: It's something about the Sony chip that produces my favorite looking pictures. I've always have pocket cameras and not relied on my iPhone for great pix. The absolute best feature of this camera is looking through the viewfinder. I forgot how different the feeling was. It's been like 15 years since my Canon Rebel II. And the best part of technology is that when you snap the picture, you can see what you shot in the viewfinder a second later so you don't have to pull the camera away and look down at the screen... This is amazing! So well thought out!!!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas T

customer_reviews.title: Great Pocket Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wildly sharp camera considering it's diminutive size. I sadly purchased this about 3 days before the version 4 came out, but there was so little difference between the two models I didn't exchange up. The RAW files are beautiful, it performs great in low light and is so completely unobtrusive compared to the DSLR cameras I usually carry. I would highly recommend this for a pocket camera for any photographer - either amateur or pro shooter.
customer_reviews.author: Soybert

customer_reviews.title: Best point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of research, the Cyber shot RX100III was my choice. It offers the most features and performance possible in pocket size point and shoot cameras. I opted to not pay the extra $150 for the RX 100 IV since the additional features there are primarily related to video. Since I'm not a heavy video user I bought the III. This camera performs extremely well in low light and has almost all of the features of my Nikon D80. This camera is not cheap but it delivers my money's worth in every way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressive so far
customer_reviews.text: Just got the camera and so far I’m impressed. If you are coming from a non Sony camera it may take some getting used to but the interface is intuitive. I just stepped outside for 5 minutes to take the attached picture, jpeg unedited not raw because I’m lazy. I’m going to Thailand for a month and didn’t want to lug my dslr so I will update on on how this little camera has held up when I get back.
customer_reviews.author: Just That Guy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera. Excellent photos, and amazing HD video. Capable of doing almost anything a SLR can do. Fast lens and large sensor make this a great low light camera. Full manual and well as multiple auto settings. I had the original and gave it to my wife. I like the built in view finder, and the pop up flash and improved controls. I will leave my Nikon D7100 at home when traveling abroad as this is soon light. Photo taken with the RX 100 iii and cropped , preserves extensive detail. Set for RAW
customer_reviews.author: G. Speck

customer_reviews.title: Great travel camera
customer_reviews.text: I also have the Sony 1/2.3 variant, which is far inferior. The 1" sensor on the RX100 III, along with the fast maximum aperture make a huge difference. This is a great travel camera and preferred when I don't want to carry around my Nikon D610 and almost 50 lbs of lenses.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for Youtube / Vlogging / Social media
customer_reviews.text: I use this camera for videos mainly. I am a vlogger for youtube, and this camera is amazing. It's auto focus was the main feature I needed to work correctly as others never worked so well. The quality of the video is insane. I can record at 1080p 60FPS which is insanely clear. It's built in wifi feature will send any pictures directly to my iphone which is handy for instagram, and other social media networks. It really helps give you that edge. I really have nothing bad to say about this camera. I wish the battery life lasted a little longer, that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: This is by far the best compact camera I've had
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best compact camera I've had. The image quality is stellar. It's easy to use, and, most importantly, small enough that I can carry it with me all the time. While I love my DSLR, it's bulky, heavy, and draws much attention. With this camera I can do street photography without intimidating anyone. As a result, I can do it quietly, without annoying people who, often, dislike a huge lens pointed at their face. Also, coming from rangefinder photography, I appreciate the pop-up viewfinder, and the fast lens is a joy.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Kurka

customer_reviews.title: You wouldn't believe this until you see the results for ...
customer_reviews.text: You wouldn't believe this until you see the results for yourself. I don't bring my DSLR (SONY A55) anymore. One thing I miss is GPS information. I'm trying to brainwash myself that GPS is not a big issue as long as I can recall where I took pictures. You -almost - MUST buy "Sony AGR2 Attachment Grip (Black)", I guess. They go together so well.
customer_reviews.author: Myungsu Kim

customer_reviews.title: The best camera you can have in your pocket
customer_reviews.text: The best camera you can have in your pocket. Most of the time great photos, snapshots is what I like more and this camera is perfect for that precisely.. Otherwise you would miss some unexpected good pictures. I don't take my FujiPro or the X100S or the Nikon D300. I just take the Sony RX100 and after I purchased the first version of it (I offered it to my daughter, who also likes it) I became addicted to it. I have the Sony always on my bag too, with my notebooks, books, fountain pens. If no other camera existed I would still be happy because I still would have this one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Santos

customer_reviews.text: When I charged the battery and turned the camera on, the screen had a greenish hue and nothing could be done to fix it. I returned the camera a purchased a Panasonic camera with similar specifications - no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry V.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for enthusiasts/semi-pro shooters
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, but worth every penny. Great camera for enthusiasts/semi-pro shooters, or professionals who need a backup or pocket sized travel camera. The RX100-III is one of the best balanced of the RX100 line. The pop up viewfinder is remarkably useful, as is the viewscreen which can be flipped 180 degrees to take selfies (built in wifi can transfer to your smartphone, and the phone can remote control the camera!)
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. So much good things to say about it, but I'll keep it two. It is easy to use and produces very high quality images for a compact camera. I carry it everywhere when I am traveling and often leave my bigger and better cameras at home.
customer_reviews.author: Peter C

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Camera But Too Small For My Large Hands.
customer_reviews.text: I can't say anything that hasn't been said about this camera before; brilliant camera... But... I have very large hands and this great product simply gets lost in them. I press one button and hit two by mistake, my thumbs get in the shots and I find I'm always hitting the power button and turning it off unintentionally. Ergonomically very awkward and uncomfortable for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Sprague Theobald

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Still learning my way around this compact camera. I like what I’ve seen so far. Some photos have been blurry. Not sure what’s going on there.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Gail Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best point and shoot out there !
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best P&S I've ever owned and I've owned quite a few and use them for pro work sometimes. I got this as an open box its, Didn't want to pay the MSRP and in my experience the Amazon open box items are almost new always. The new version of this camera @ almost 1k dollars is just cray expensive and is not that much better than this model. Unless 4k is your required need you can do everything w this camera. Love the Sony app store and being able to upload to my smart phone and share images.
customer_reviews.author: Angel E. Valentin

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this camera and so does every other photographer that ...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this camera and so does every other photographer that I show it to. I used this as a secondary camera for a 50-day expedition but half way through stopped carrying my Canon SLR because this was doing so well and is just so damn portable, quick, and great to use. LOVE the pop-up viewfinder!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera. So many features that I haven't made good use of yet. But it does take amazing photos, limited only by the user's imagination and skill. The wireless upload works, but with some coaxing; could be simpler somehow. We will definitely make good use of it on our upcoming vacation.
customer_reviews.author: mc

customer_reviews.title: Nice, pocketable, great image quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm very much infatuated with this camera. After years of having substandard point-and-shoots and a beautiful Canon DSLR but nothing in between, this camera is a great way to travel light and get super pictures without the bulk of an DSLR. I'm still learning it, but I have made some really nice pictures since getting it, especially candids, and I only expect to get better at using it as I get more comfortable with the controls and customize it to my liking.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Lens Cap
customer_reviews.text: A Kaiser 55mm push on lens cap will work while a snap on will not. A lens cap holder is useful..
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: FUN!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! Just got back from vacation and am previewing my shots, and am amazed by the quality of the lens. So much more convenient than my dslr! The light weight, lens, angled back screen, ability to shoot raw, make this my new favorite! Only problem is the positioning of the movie button, as I shot a dozen videos just by the way I hold the camera. Still great fun to use! *****
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great travel camera
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a travel camera that could compete with my DSLR, and this one fits the bill. Great photo quality for its size. Lots of controls which take some practice, but are pretty intuitive and usable with practice. Relatively light and small. Zoom could be a bit more powerful but this is mainly for "stand in front of that fountain" kind of pictures. Control buttons a bit small, but overall a very fine camera.
customer_reviews.author: North Shore Reader

customer_reviews.title: Now with the viewfinder and faster lens it is even better. Yet I would not recommend anyone who already ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't think of any other camera that can replace this one, and I can think of so many cameras that can be replaced by the RX100. Image quality combined with its compactness makes this a must have camera to anyone. I have never taken any camera more often with me than the RX100 . Now with the viewfinder and faster lens it may just the only camera you ever need. However, I would not recommend an upgrade to anyone who already has previous model. Viewfinder and faster lens are nice, but remember it is also a tad heavier and bulkier.
customer_reviews.author: Frank N70

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Pictures
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. Compact but takes amazing pictures and videos. It has the wifi function, but haven't really used it yet. Took it on our camping trip and we got so many amazing pictures (including some amazing action shots) from this Sony camera. For work, we used it to take take some high quality product shots and the outcome was incredible. Would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Cate

customer_reviews.title: Amazing portable camera.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera quality. Pocketable camera. I ended up selling this to my brother for an interchangeable lens system, but i really do miss this thing. has everything an enthusiast would want - quick function button, manual controls, EVF, great zeiss glass. the xavc s video codec is amazing as well. would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a more portable, high quality camera.
customer_reviews.author: itspoots

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful photos from such a compact camera
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful photos from such a compact camera. There is a learning curve to go from shooting in Automatic to shooting in different modes. Have got some amazing shots however from the Automatic mode. The small size is super convenient to just throw in my purse when the DSLR is too cumbersome and bulky.
customer_reviews.author: M. A.

customer_reviews.title: Nice backpacking camera.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible quality for the size. Great size for backpacking. Only two complaints. I wish the auto bracketing function enabled a wider range of f/stop bracketing for HDR post processing. I would like to see +- 2 stops in 1 stop increments. Also, I really missed having the ability to attach a polarizer on my last trip. Otherwise it is a great camera if you don't want to carry pounds of glass. One suggestion, buy extra batteries for back up.
customer_reviews.author: RLTPORT

customer_reviews.title: excellent camera maybe a bit overpriced
customer_reviews.text: dro. . king at photos online from this camera, I can tell that people are not fully using the camera and all its features. I see many wash down and overexposed photos being posted online..with the right custom settings you can take some stellar photos with this camera..the cameras physical build is excellent..my biggest criticism of the camera is its tendency to blow out highlights, but like I said with the right settings involving exposure compensation and DRO you can get beautiful images
customer_reviews.author: Aaron S

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: Stunningly wonderful little camera. It looks like a point-and-shoot, but performs like a DSLR. Every time I pick it up, I learn some new amazing thing it will do. Sony manual is pathetically inadequate, however. I'd highly recommend getting the third-party book, Photographer's Guided to the Sony DSC-RX100 III (Alexander S. White) to get the most out of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: NixaWalt

customer_reviews.title: Best pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this camera, except for the fact that it doesn't come with a charger for the battery
customer_reviews.author: Hoang Le

customer_reviews.title: ... camera and can confidently say that it is the best portable camera
customer_reviews.text: I recently received this camera and can confidently say that it is the best portable camera. Even though I have Sony A7, I prefer this little but very capable camera to take photos. The built - in EVF is very good and I like how the screen is now can be turned to 180 degree. The codec XAVC in this camera is superb. Quite amazing how Sony is able to put all these features in this small camera. The only issue I have is battery - I get about 290 shots in Raw + JPEG so I recommend potential buyers to purchase an extra battery.
customer_reviews.author: Christian JY Song

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pocket-sized camera!
customer_reviews.text: I am constantly impressed by the quality of the photos from this camera! Even my friend who has a dSLR and multiple thousand-dollar lenses wants one. It's great for traveling and won't weigh you down. I bought a mag filter adapter so I can use a polarizing lense with it and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Crossland

customer_reviews.title: I love it as much as my Alpha99
customer_reviews.text: I have had still cameras for 60 years, video since 1968. This little gem lives in my fanny pack with keys, wallet and spare glasses. It does everything I want, less a polarizer. It is NOT waterproof, and the finder and flash are not robust. I love it as much as my Alpha99.
customer_reviews.author: SixtyYearNerd

customer_reviews.title: Faulty lens cover and bad service.
customer_reviews.text: From the outset my camera has seemed defective. I have had to send it to back to Sony (Precision Camera) twice as the lens cover does not completely open and close. Both times they inspected it, sent it back, and said there is nothing wrong. I have never been able to speak to anyone about this. Now it is happening again--third time in less than a year. I like the camera itself, but it is pretty useless when the lens cover does not work.
customer_reviews.author: BD-Lu

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Took over 50 pics front row at concert different settings everyone the face was whited out n pic blurry. I have a lot cheaper one pics were better
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Paula L. Dunbar

customer_reviews.title: ... after viewing reviews on several others and I'm very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera after viewing reviews on several others and I'm very happy with it. The small size is great for taking on trips as it fits in my pocket or a small purse. I've yet to take an out of focus picture and the pictures are sharp even though I tend to move slightly when faking them. It's a great camera. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Corinne

customer_reviews.title: It is the camera I grab first!
customer_reviews.text: It is an amazing camera considering its size and outstanding picture quality. I had the original and the added features are superb! I find myself leaving my D800 home because it is so heavy. This camera is my favorite and the first one I gab. Its picture quality is way above the $450.00 class very small P&S. The one inch sensor makes a huge improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Zeb

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I initially bought the original edition earlier this year, and then realized the newer one has more options that I missed on the earlier one. So I sold the other one and bought this one. The image quality with this camera is incredible. 13x19" prints look wonderful and the high quality images allow for cropped images that retain their sharpness (within reasonable limits, however).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The image and video quality is great, great low light performance
customer_reviews.text: The image and video quality is great, great low light performance, better than low end canon SLR / rebel. It's small can compact and somewhat fits in my jean pocket. I also drop it a couple times and I can't believe it's still working. The image stabilization is pretty great. Timeless app isn't free, and it runs camera app kind of slow. The grip is not great, so you might need two hand to operate it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Best Point and Shoot I've ever used great featureset!
customer_reviews.text: best point and shoot you can get! Love this thing! you can send photos to your phone + it has a LCD that you can pull out to use for a selfie. quality is great, low night is good enough for a point and shot and the best thing is that it's nice and portable so you can put it in your pocket easily built in flash and pop up viewfinder is good
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Guyton

customer_reviews.title: excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: excellent camera - rugged - dropped about 3 feet onto concrete with no consequences, great pics
customer_reviews.author: mercifullyfree

customer_reviews.title: A real powerhouse in a small package
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding image quality, excellent low light capabilities producing minimum noise, compact but powerful. Incorporates many features normally found in mid to high level DSLRs, three video formats producing high quality 1080 HD video. However, due in large part to the camera's extensive functionality, it is somewhat complex and complicated.
customer_reviews.author: macmanG5

customer_reviews.title: Sony has out done themselves!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this camera a couple of days ago and I have been playing with the different settings since then. This camera takes excellent, clear photos, even if the person is moving in the photo. I purchased this camera to take pictures of my 2 year old twins. It was practically impossible to take pictures of them with our nikon cool pics camera, because the pictures would come out super blurry and grainy because the kids were always moving, but this camera is a solution to that problem. It also has a very quick shutter speed as compared to most cameras. I would buy this camera over and over again
customer_reviews.author: Marissa C.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Camera Is The One You Have With You
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers covered the technical prowess of this camera well. It certainly lives up to its reputation. The main reason I consider this camera to be a winner is its photo quality.. even on automatic settings. I've historically been stuck between larger cameras that shot great pictures but were cumbersome to carry around and pocket-able cameras that shot underwhelming photos. This camera seems to have struck the perfect balance between quality and form. It is worth noting, as another reviewer mentioned, that the zoom is down to 24-70. IMO this is absolutely fine because most of my photos are scene-based or easily close enough for 70 to be sufficient. Perhaps less suitable if you're bird watching.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: One of the best Point and Shoot cameras
customer_reviews.text: This camera is fantastic. I have only had it for a few weeks now, but it is an excellent point and shoot camera. By far the best I have used to date. It is very quick to focus, takes some great low light shots, colors looks good and 1080p video is pretty good too. I prefer to take this with me as it is much more convenient to carry around than my bigger DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: Jpeezy

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera! The only thing that i have a complain is that it is not very comfortable to hold. But otherwise it takes amazing pictures!
customer_reviews.author: ZP

customer_reviews.title: BEST Pocket Camera!
customer_reviews.text: BEST pocket camera around. Rivals an entry level SLR (from a guy that also owns a semi-pro Nikon D7000 and a professional-grade Canon 5D Mark III). Has all the manual controls. Viewfinder is AMAZING! Great Wifi function to transfer to smartphone. Totally love this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo

customer_reviews.title: The Real Deal...
customer_reviews.text: Short and sweet; this little guy is the real deal... Build quality, image quality (good at higher ISOs), EVF, flash...it's just awesome and oh, so portable... I bought it to replace a Leica D-Lux 5, as a portable alternative to augment my gear and as a quick, point-and-shoot option... I honestly believe I could use it as my primary Weapon of Image Production (WIP; need to trademark that) and be satisfied... I'm 6'2" and wear XL gloves but don't find this "too small"; it's meant to be a small, portable option! Overall, I love this thing...
customer_reviews.author: YankGooner

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, can take photos of really great quality (better than most phones that are one or two years old). Also a reasonable weight and size to carry while travelling! I've been using this to take most of my photos that went onto my travel blog :)
customer_reviews.author: young250

customer_reviews.title: THE premium compact camera available today.
customer_reviews.text: THE premium compact camera available today. I continue to be astounded by the image quality it delivers, and the feature set is so extensive I can't imagine wanting more in this camera class.
customer_reviews.author: James K.

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT LITTLE CAMERA!
customer_reviews.text: A GREAT LITTLE CAMERA! The Sony RX100 series cameras are the best out there an the most popular!
customer_reviews.author: J. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for movies as well as stills
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality images. I use it for vlogging and it works great. The mic picks up the sound beautifully. For me, I wish the wristband was on the other side, but oh well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera and takes wonderful photos
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera and takes wonderful photos! It is easy to transfer pictures to your phone. Make sure you download the app! & everything came unbroken and perfectly untouched! Love it. Def recommend for photographers plus you tubers!
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera - Not Really Pocketable
customer_reviews.text: I will not go into the technical details of the camera. Professional reviewers did and will review it much better than me. All I can say is that for such a small camera, and from a still-photo perspective, there is almost nothing you cannot adjust. The photo quality is amazing even at high ISO. The viewfinder and tilting screen are more than rare in such cameras. My only take, and it is not worth taking out a star, is the size. I have a Canon PowerShot S120 and it is "pocketable." I am a big guy, and I can still cannot fit it in my pocket. It is still small enough though and truly worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: A.D.D.

customer_reviews.title: This was a great camera to take on our Mediterranean vacation
customer_reviews.text: This was a great camera to take on our Mediterranean vacation. It handled low light situations easily with out a flash which was a real life saver in a lot of the churches and museums.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Great quality images in auto mode
customer_reviews.text: Great quality images in auto mode, I rarely manually adjust. Love the ability to trigger from your smartphone and upload wirelessly.
customer_reviews.author: Njay

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a gift
customer_reviews.text: My daughter used this on a hiking trip and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera for it's size
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than I expected. A pocket camera if your wearing cargo pants. EVF a bit awkward. Seems well constructed. IQ is very good given the nature of this camera.

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful combination of picture quality and size
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful combination of picture quality, flexibility and small size. My new favorite travel camera. Love the fast lens, wish it had a little more reach.

customer_reviews.text: I expected something more for that price however my phone (flagship android) does most pictures not less good

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, love it
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, love it! It is so nice to have something small enough to fit in my handbag. This camera has great ability to shoot indoor images. Set it on Intelligent auto and GO.

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! It has taken my photographic capacities to the next level. I was looking for the best compact camera on the market . . . something with near dslr quality in a compact frame. This is it! Nothing but good to say about it!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful camera, amazingly sharp images
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful camera, amazingly sharp images. I have the first one and love it. I bought this for my wife and it's even better. Worth the money when you don't want to carry a DSLR. Wish the high ISO was a little better, but it is amazing for a point and shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth H Marchionno

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase and product
customer_reviews.text: This camera arrived packaged in the original box with all extras included (charger box/cable, battery). Being used, there was one minor scratch on the display screen, but the camera is in perfect working condition! I saved over $100 buying used and it was scary but now that I have the product I would say it was worth it because you almost can't even tell it had ever been used.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used and it's still in great condition. I would buy another one.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. Like the size since it can fit ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Like the size since it can fit in your pants pocket. Pictures' quality are awesome once you know the settings of the camera. Overall, a great travel camera if you don't want to carry your DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I bought the RX100 Mark I as my first "real" camera when it came out, and I was already blown away. I decided to sell the old one to get this new model, and it was definitely worth it. I won't try to list all the great things about it, since the rest of the internet has done a good job with that. I'm sure I could think of some very minor annoyances to mention, but to be honest this revision literally has everything I could ask for and more. It also *looks* beautiful, which is more than can be said for some other cameras competing on size.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas G

customer_reviews.title: This is a great camera. Takes really good photos
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. Takes really good photos, is fairly compact and has lots of different settings. The sports mode has been particularly good at my son's basketball games.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.KSH

customer_reviews.title: Great images from this compact point-and-shoot
customer_reviews.text: So far I have no complaints other than short battery life and $798 price tag. Auto focus indoors in low light could be better. Great image quality (both photos and video) for a compact point-and-shoot camera. In some instances its photos look almost as good as my old Nikon D300. Really good looking video, although it auto focuses very slowly in video mode - otherwise video stays nice and sharp and clear when zooming (unlike every other compact point-and-shoot camera I have used. Very customizable. I purchased this as a birthday present for my wife, and she says she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Gurgs

customer_reviews.title: Great camera with a few cons ..but plenty of positives to out weight them.......
customer_reviews.text: As advertised ..look at all the reviews on camera sites etc...very good reviews..This is a great camera full of features especially on the video side . Some of the reviews say this is the best point and shoot camera possibly ever made . So far I love it .

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera, handles low-light situations very well, great compact size.

customer_reviews.title: I'm really pleased with the quality of pictures this camera takes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take with me on a backpacking trip. I was looking for something comparable to my Canon SLR but not as heavy. I'm really pleased with the quality of pictures this camera takes. It can still shoot RAW and takes great night shots. It doesn't have much zoom but I take more scenic landscape shots so I knew this before purchasing and I don't miss the zoom capability.

customer_reviews.text: Just the right size to take anywhere, but could use a larger grip. Handles easily with a great electronic viewfinder and tons of readily available info for each photo. It is a great complement to my Sony A7.

customer_reviews.title: DSLR-like
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing. Just read the features. A small, DSLR-like camera, which is nice.

customer_reviews.title: excellent point and shoot with lots of more advanced features
customer_reviews.text: Met all of my expectations that I had read about beforehand. Image quality is very good. Operational controls are mostly intuitive. Love the size (that's why I bought it). Slips easily into my pocket. The viewfinder is very sharp. The only thing I wish it had is a larger zoom capability.

customer_reviews.title: Picture Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Camera arrived in excellent condition and with everything promised included in the shipping box. Products were well cared for and the price was more than fair. I've used the camera twice already with no misgivings.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing point and shoot camera even for a novice!
customer_reviews.text: I am a complete novice when it comes to cameras but the shots I go with this camera can not be beat. I was continually astonished and amazed by the quality of the photos with this PNS camera. This was an amazing investment. The ease of use and the ability to transfer photos wirelessly sold me alone. I couldn’t have asked for a better camera to capture the memories of my most recent trip. Best investment I have ever made in a camera! Also love the selfie option especially when traveling to such phenomenal places without a picture partner. I would buy this again and again.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for awhile.
customer_reviews.text: The camera worked great for about 2 weeks, but in the LCD screen a white line appeared on the left side going from top to bottom. Not too big of a deal since it doesn't effect the actual footage, just kinda annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Werner

customer_reviews.title: I shoot a lot and while I love the small size of this camera
customer_reviews.text: I shoot a lot and while I love the small size of this camera, its weight, its durability and its amazing amount of functions, I am disappointed in the final product. The shots lack crispness and the colors are not as rich as I would like. Still, for traveling lightly or taking pics at a party, it's hard to beat for convenience, and I like its selfie mode function with the reversible screen.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: I really like this camera
customer_reviews.text: I really like this camera, but before you buy it, you need to ask if you REALLY need it. This camera has the quality of a 600$ camera. What makes it so expensive? It's size. So if you really want a small camera with GREAT quality, get it, but if you just need a high quality camera, I suggest getting a canon or a nikon for less than 700$

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 





Absolutely stunning picture quality, compact enough to take anywhere. Now your photos maintain soft background defocus even when zoomed in with the improved f1.8-2.8 24-70mm Zeiss lens. There's even a pop-up electronic viewfinder for eye-level framing and a 180ｰdegree tiltable screen for 20.1MP4 selfies. Lastly, the ultra-fast BIONZ X processor adds speed and accuracy for stills as well as beautiful HD video. 




TECHNOLOGY


20.1MP4 1-INCH EXMOR R SENSOR
Featuring a large 1.0” Exmor R CMOS image sensor. The back-illuminated technology doubles light sensitivity and combines with Sony’s Column A/D Conversion to reduce noise levels — a great help when photographing in dimly lit environments. Markedly reduced noise is evident even when high-sensitivity settings are used for capturing night landscapes or indoor scenes.

ZEISS VARIO-SONNAR T* 24-70MM F1.8-2.8 LENS
The DSC-RX100 III sports an all new bright F1.8-2.8 Zeiss Vario-Sonnar T* lens with 24-70mm zoom. The lens is perfect for portraits and macro shots with beautiful defocused - bokeh backgrounds. A premium multi-layered T* coating also dramatically reduces ghost and flare caused by light reflection.

BUILT-IN SVGA OLED VIEWFINDER W/ ZEISS T* COATING
View every scene in rich detail with the bright and retractable SVGA OLED Tru-Finder. The viewfinder faithfully displays what will appear in your recording, including the effects of your camera settings, so you can accurately monitor the results. The Zeiss T* coating enhances clarity and reduces flare and reflection in the eyepiece optics.




SELFIE-READY MULTI-ANGLE 3" XTRA FINE LCD DISPLAY
Selfies have never been easier with a beautiful 3” (1,229k dots) Xtra Fine LCD Display that rotates in multiple angles. This also makes it easy to photograph over crowds or low to capture pets eye to eye by swinging up and down approximately 180 degrees. Easily scroll through menus and preview your shot thanks to WhiteMagic technology that dramatically increases visibility in bright daylight. The large display delivers brilliant-quality still images and movies while enabling easy focusing operation.

VERSATILE SHOOTING W/ XAVC S2, AVCHD AND MP4 CODECS1
The DSC-RX100 III records HD movies1 in the XAVC S2 format, which uses MPEG-4 AVC/H.264 for video compression and linear PCM for audio compression, while saving files in a MP4 wrapper. The highly compressed files allow extensive record times. With 50Mbps Full HD (1920x1080) 60p high quality video recording, XAVC S enables beautiful video recording with minimal compression noise even in scenes with a lot of movement. Linear PCM is adopted for audio compression. The camera also records in AVCHD, ideal for quality video for HDTV and Blu-ray Disc burning. Additionally, users can shoot the easily shareable MP4 HD video, ideal for web.

BUILT-IN ND FILTER FOR WIDER-RANGING PHOTOGRAPHIC EXPRESSION
Realize a wider range of photographic expression with built-in 1/8 (3 EV steps) ND filter that allows exposure adjustment in bright scenes.




HDMI CLEAR OUTPUT FOR UNCOMPRESSED VIDEO RECORDINGS3
Clear, uncompressed digital movie signal output can be transferred to an external monitor/recorder (connected via the HDMI terminal) simultaneously in real time from the RX100 III3. The shooting info display can be turned off for even cleaner views of such movies on an external monitor/recorder. Frame rates include 24p, 60p and 60i.

COMFORTABLE CONTROL RING FOR MANUAL OPERATION
A unique control ring around the lens works in combination with an intuitive, displayed user interface for meticulous SLR-type control over settings that satisfies even the most fastidious users. The control ring can be assigned to adjust various features (at various values) from basics like zooming and aperture to creative functions like Picture Effect. Moreover, it turns smoothly and seamlessly, allowing quiet, click-free usage while shooting movies including a new step-zoom function that enables instant selection of commonly used focal lengths.

SIMPLE CONNECTIVITY TO SMARTPHONES VIA WI-FI W/ NFC
Connectivity with smartphones for One-touch sharing/One-touch remote has been simplified with Wi-Fi/NFC control. In addition to Wi-Fi support for connecting to smartphones, the DSC-RX100 III also supports NFC (near field communication) - providing “touch connection” convenience when transferring images to compatible Android smartphones and tablets. Users need only touch devices to connect; no complex set-up is required. Moreover, when using Smart Remote Control — a feature that allows shutter release to be controlled by a smartphone — connection between DSC-RX100 III and the smartphone can be established by simply touching devices.







ENHANCE YOUR CAMERA WITH PLAYMEMORIES CAMERA APPS11
Personalize your camera by adding new features of your choice with PlayMemories Camera Apps. Find apps to fit your shooting style from portraits, detailed close-ups, sports, time lapse, motion shot and much more. Use apps that shoot, share and save photos using Wi-Fi that make it easy to control and view your camera from smartphone, and post photos directly to Facebook or backup images to the cloud without connecting to a computer.
